result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Holloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Balance due within 30 days. 
Failure to pay will result in one day jail for every $25.00 outstanding.

Submit to DNA sample by 4-30-2016, at the Ozaukee County Jail.
Court waived statutory DNA fee.
Atty fees ($593) due in 60 days. Failure to pay results in 1 day jail for every $25 owed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R Holloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Atty fees ($593) due in 60 days. Failure to pay results in 1 day jail for every $25 owed.

Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing to address atty fees. Court takes non-appearance as no objection to atty fees.  Court orders atty fees due in 60 days with failure to pay being 1 day for ever $25 owed.
Per the Court: hearing set to set payment plan for atty fees (not addressed at sentencing)
for payment of attorney fees - forwarded to branch

Current: 728 State Rd 57  Unit 10, Plymouth, WI 53073 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2016)
Prior: 728 Sth 57 #10, Plymouth, WI 53073

Defendant James R Holloway in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant James R Holloway in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant James R Holloway in court with Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel request an adjourment.  
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Conditions set by court: not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
**mailed to attorney**
Attorney Matthew E. Weil is a COURT APPOINTED ATTORNEY.

Defendant James R Holloway in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant spoke with public defender and does not qualify for representation. Court advises of penalites. Defendant requests a court appointed attorney. 
9:10 a.m. case recalled Attorney Weil is now appearing as court appointed attorney.  
Attorney Weil received copy of the complaint, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea. 
Further proceedings scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 09:15 am.
